title: 105_s170
content: The "Clone Pager Authorization Act of 1996" may be cited as the short title. It pertains to wire and electronic communications. The "Clone Pager Authorization Act of 1996" adds a definition for clone pager communication and prohibits the use of clone pagers in wire and electronic communications. The "Clone Pager Authorization Act of 1996" defines terms for pen registers, trap and trace devices, and clone pagers for chapter 206. The "Clone Pager Authorization Act of 1996" defines terms for pen registers, trap and trace devices, and clone pagers for chapter 206, with an amendment in SEC. 3. Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code, is amended to include clone pagers in addition to trap and trace devices. Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code, is amended to include clone pagers along with trap and trace devices. This involves inserting clone pagers in various sections and updating the terminology to include them. Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code is amended to include clone pagers in addition to trap and trace devices. The term "clone pager" is inserted in various sections and terminology is updated accordingly. Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code is amended to include clone pagers in addition to trap and trace devices. The court can authorize the use of a pen register, trap and trace device, or a clone pager upon application under section 3122. The court can authorize the use of a pen register, trap and trace device, or a clone pager if relevant to an ongoing criminal investigation. The clone pager includes identifying the subscriber of the paging device. The court can authorize the use of a pen register, trap and trace device, or a clone pager for a criminal investigation. The clone pager must identify the subscriber of the paging device. Amendments include specifying the number of the paging device for a clone pager interception. Amendments allow for the use of a pen register, trap and trace device, or clone pager in criminal investigations. The clone pager must identify the subscriber of the paging device, with specific details on the number of the paging device for interception. Amendments in section 3124 allow for the use of a pen register, trap and trace device, or clone pager in criminal investigations. The clone pager must identify the subscriber of the paging device for interception. The amendments in section 3124 allow for the use of a clone pager in criminal investigations. A Federal court may order a provider of a paging service to furnish all necessary information and assistance to law enforcement officers for the operation and use of the clone pager. The amendments in section 3124 allow for the use of a clone pager in criminal investigations. A Federal court may order a provider of a paging service to furnish all necessary information and assistance to law enforcement officers for the operation and use of the clone pager unobtrusively. In section 3124, the use of a clone pager in criminal investigations is permitted. A provider of a paging service can be ordered by a Federal court to provide information and assistance for the operation of the clone pager. In section 3126, the term "clone pager" is defined as a numeric display device that receives communications intended for another numeric display paging device. The Senate passed the bill on November 7, 1997.
